This can be used without the pattern provider, it will just be an auto craft for a single craft that you will provide in it with a patter.
You can get this by putting a fluid extractor next to a certus crystal block instead of a log.
32 channels with live info.
In order to access your system, you'll need various types of terminals.
The basic ME Terminal will allow you to insert and extract items.
The ME Crafting Terminal allows insertion and extraction, as well as providing a 3x3 crafting grid that can access the items in your system.
Patterns are the first things you want to automate.
Just put it in a charger, can be automated simply with things like hoppers.
Mix it with water, and you will obtain certus quartz.

This will "remember" the automation you ask for, it is a multiblock that will need at least one of each, but take into account that the more unit you have (with components) the bigger your craft can be, and the more co-processing unit the more thing he will be able to do at the same time.
Those two are the upgrade you will mostly use in your AE system.

The more advanced machines and items will need Fluix Crystals, which are made by tossing a Charged Certus Quartz, a piece of Nether Quartz, and a piece of Redstone into a puddle of water and waiting a moment for them to combine.
Additionally, to make life easier in the future, AE2 has a Charger that can be used to charge normal Certus Quartz.
Applied Energisitcs guide is quite complete so follow it.
32 channels
Make the biggest cactus farm you can in a 128 spatial pylon and make it work (using garden cloch is okay as long as it is in an AE sub-dimension).
BONUS QUEST !!!

This is something you should automate quickly.

Note that, for multiblocks you should use a temporary storage between the two machine such as a chest or a hopper as sometimes it can just void item.

Isn't really needed today, but we never know.

ftbquests.chapter.beginning.quest3532921: This modpack is tech oriented, that mean no magic mod, no overpowered enchantment and no new hardcore mobs or boss.
ftbquests.chapter.beginning.quest3540075: It is recommended to automate at the very least the items and ressources asked in the quest book.
ftbquests.chapter.beginning.quest3647552: If you found a village you should keep it as you will probably need to trade with villagers.

ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest1409329: With this block you can use energy to power a furnace (only work on vanilla furnace), place it behind a furnace and hook it up to a powerline.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest1614317: Take LV current and transform it to MV ( function both ways)
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest1614814: This lantern when connected with LV power will emit light like a glowstone block, and will prevent mob spawning in a 32 block radius.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest1635434: This armor can help you not taking damage to any wire.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest1977488: You can use the coal coke to power the blast furnace it is quite efficient.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest2208863: Same than before but took MV to convert to HV.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest2598654: The Arc Furnace is a massive multiblock furnace that can smelt and double ores directly, make steel and other alloys, and do it all 12 at a time and much faster than almost any other furnace.

But it needs Graphite Electrodes in order to operate. To make the electrodes, you'll need to grind some coal coke down into dust and then squeeze the dust into HOP Graphite Dust and finally smelt the graphite dust into HOP Graphite Ingots that can be formed into the electrodes.
Each electrode requires 4 HOP Graphite Ingots to make and the Arc Furnace needs 3 electrodes to function.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest2793878: Now that we're moving on to bigger and better machines, we're going to need ways to move items around.
The Conveyors will transport items and can extract and insert from adjacent inventories.
There are even conveyors with trapdoors to drop items in the world, vertical conveyors to move items straight upward, splitting conveyors to alternate the path, and covered conveyors.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest3451729: This will be one of the few possibility to store items, other option will be :
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest3580532: With this multiblock you will be able to make your plate, gear, rods and wire for cheaper and or easier.
Some plates are made with materials that are just to hard to be made with just a hammer.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest3816212: Insulated cable do not deal any damage, useful isn't it.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest3888521: The Excavator is another massive multiblock that will dig up ores in the current chunk.
The Excavator consumes 4,096 RF/t, so you'll want to make sure you're producing enough power before hooking this beast up.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest3978768: Put them on each side of the improved blast furnace to make it faster, you will need to send RF in those.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest4128802: This is the most optimised way as it will produce the most energy in this config (3 waterwheels).
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest4217258: Build a fully functional Alternator working with steam generated from distilled water.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest4687477: I don't know for you but I like this wood for building.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest5094017: Dynamo are needed for each wind mill and for 3 newt to each other water wheel.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest5424928: As we upgrade our resource processing, we're going to need to look at gathering more resources more quickly for all that processing speed.
Although we don't have access to a full quarry, we can start off with the Excavator, which will dig up ores in the current chunk.

However, it doesn't dig up just any ore. In Immersive Engineering, each chunk is randomly generated with certain types of ores that can be excavated independent of the actual ores in the ground. To find out what will be excavated, place a Core Sample Drill in the chunk, power it, and wait a short time for it to drill a sample. The sample will tell you what the Excavator will dig up.
Tip: The Core Samples can be placed on the ground to remind you of what is in the chunk.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6267325: The Assembler is a multiblock that can store items for and automatically craft up to 3 stored recipes, including recipes that use liquids.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6346237: Right click the center of the mill, to apply the sail and improve energy generation.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6745748: The other ingredient for biodiesel is Ethanol.
Ethanol is made in the Fermenter from crops like sugar canes, apples, potatoes, melons, etc.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6759992: This is faster and can be more fatser by adding the pre-heater.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6777111: The Crusher is the first major piece of equipment on the road to industrial resource processing.

This large multiblock accepts ores and other blocks dropped into the top of it and crushes them down quickly into their dusts and automatically outputs to an inventory on the front (or a conveyor, hint hint).
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6932159: Now that we're building larger machines, they're going to need larger amounts of power. We should probably think about building a better generator.
That generator is the Diesel Generator, which can generate up to 4,096 RF/t. It burns biodiesel to generate power.
To make biodiesel, we'll need to refine plant oil and ethanol.
Plant Oil is made by squeezing seeds in the Industrial Squeezer.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest6942403: This multblock tank can store up to 512 buckets of fluid.
It can insert or extract from the top or bottom, but requires a redstone signal to start the extraction and a Fluid Pump to extract.
This will be one of the few possibility to store liquid, other option will be :
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest7320398: You put iron and either charcoal (less efficient) or coal coke to fire it up.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest7332317: Time to seriously upgrade your resource processing. The Arc Furnace smelts up to 12 items at once and can make steel and other alloys faster than any other machine so far.
Note that to finishe this pack you have to make one, for one of the gems.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest7531070: Now we burn the biodiesel in the Diesel Generator.
ftbquests.chapter.immersive.quest7711639: The Core Sample Drill can also tell you if an Oil Reservoir is present in a chunk. If there is one, the Pumpjack can be used to extract the oil.
You can also setup multiple Pumpjacks to extract the oil even faster.

ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest16561243: It's time to amp up your power production with your very own Fusion Reactor.
To get started, we'll want to setup the production chain to produce the fuels needed to sustain the reaction.

First up - Deuterium, which is produced by running Heavy Water through an Electrolytic Separator. Heavy Water is obtained by running an Electric Pump over a water source with the Filter Upgrade installed.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest16925663: Now that we have some basic Mekanism infrastructure, we can look at increasing the yield of our ore processing.

In order to get 3 ingots per ore, we need to add Oxygen into a Purification Chamber with our ore which will produce 3 ore clumps per ore. Thes clumps are then processed in a Crusher to produce 3 dirty dusts which are processed in an Enrichment Chamber to produce 3 dusts which can be smelted into ingots.
To get Oxygen for our Purification Chamber, we'll need an Electrolytic Separator which will take water and split it into Hydrogen and Oxygen.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest17084450: Link your base with redstone wire and alarm so that you can link it either to your power stroage to know when it is dangerously low or to your nuclear reactor to know when radiation are being emitted.
You will need a screw driver to configure your wire.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest30923345: Now that we have Brine, we can start adding onto our triple ingot production to do quadruple ingot production.
First up, we'll need an Electrolytic Separator to process the Brine into Sodium and Chlorine. Then, we combine the Chlorine with Hydrogen in a Chemical Infuser to make Hydrogen Chloride.

The Hydrogen Chloride is pumped into a Chemical Injection Chamber with our ores to produce 4 ore shards per ore. These shards then go into our existing triple ore processing setup to be made into ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest39709943: In order to move up to 4 ingots per ore, we'll need to setup Brine production.
Brine is used in the production of Hydrogen Chloride which we need for quadruple ore processing.
Brine is made in the Thermal Evaporation Plant, a large multiblock structure (4x4x up to 18 high) that uses heat and water to create Brine.
The Thermal Evaporation Plant is affected by the biome it is located in for heat production and heat retention. Hint: Deserts are good.

To build your plant, start by building a 4x4x1 platform of Thermal Evaporation Blocks and then building up a hollow tower from there up to a max height of 18 blocks. Replace 2 of the blocks anywhere in the structure with Valves so you can input water and extract Brine. Place the Advanced Solar Generators at the corners of the top layer. Finally, replace any block, except corners, with the Thermal Evaporation Controller.
If everything is placed correctly, you should see red particles when it forms.

The Advanced Solar Generators on top will passively heat the plant, but you can increase the heat generation, as well as keep it hot at night, by pumping in heat from the Resistive Heater (which converts RF power to heat) or the Fuelwood Heater (which burns fuels to produce heat) through a Valve.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest41428401: With cardboard you can stock machine or block with storage insinde of them, to easily transport them.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest46290498: Les useful than the one from Industrial Foregoing as it really ine the block so if there is nothing left it will not mine anything, but It can mine specific ore or blocks
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest46785885: Moving up from 4 ingots to 5 ingots per ore is a rather involved process that starts with the production of Sulfuric Acid.

We'll need a supply of Gunpowder for this process as Sulfur is extracted from Gunpowder. Gunpowder can be crafted by placing Gravel in a Purification Chamber with Oxygen to create Flint and then Crushing the Flint into Gunpowder.
Insert your Gunpowder with Hydrogen Chloride into a Chemical Injection Chamber to make Sulfur.
Process the Sulfur in a Chemical Oxidizer to make Sulfur Dioxide and combine that with Oxygen in a Chemical Infuser to make Sulfur Trioxide.
Create Water Vapor with a Rotary Condensentrator supplied with water and then combine the Sulfur Trioxide with the Water Vapor in a Chemical Infuser to produce Sulfuric Acid.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest56321828: Besides the Hohlraum with D-T Fuel, the other thing we need to kickstart the reaction is a very large infusion of power very quickly.
The Laser Amplifier collects the power of up to 5 Lasers aimed at it and stores it. The Amplifier can be controlled with redstone, so it can be triggered when enough power has been stored.
For reference, the initial energy requirement is somewhere in the neighborhood of 600,000,000 to 800,000,000 RF.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest60394969: Store fluid, can be used like a bucket.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest64435246: The other fuel we need is Tritium.
This one is a little more involved to produce.

First, you'll want to build another Thermal Evaporation Plant, but instead of feeding it water, you'll want to feed it Brine. When Brine is processed in the Thermal Evaporation Plant, it produces Liquid Lithium.
Next, process the Liquid Lithium into Lithium gas in a Rotary Condensentrator.
Finally, process the Lithium gas in a Solar Neutron Activator to produce Tritium.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest67153273: Now is the time to master the processing of ores. Adding our Sulfuric Acid to the processing chain will allow us to produce 5 ingots per ore.
To start, place your ores in a Chemical Dissolution Chamber with the Sulfuric Acid. This will produce an ore slurry.
The ore slurry is then combined with water in a Chemical Washer to produce a clean ore slurry.
The Chemical Crystallizer processes the clean ore slurry into ore crystals, which are then processed into the previous 4 ingot setup.
Congratulations, you are now making 5 ingots per ore!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest72772951: The Induction Matrix is a multiblock structure made up of 4 components - Casings, Ports, Providers, and Cells.
The Induction Matrix can be up to 18x18x18 in size, and requires at least one provider and one cell.
Induction Ports are the blocks used for input and output from the Matrix. You'll probably want at least 2 of these - one for input and one for output.

Induction Cells are the blocks that actually store the energy. These are placed inside the structure and can be of any tier, even differing tiers. The capacities of all the cells are added together to determine the maximum capacity of the Matrix.

Induction Providers are blocks that determine how much energy can be output from the Matrix per tick. If multiple providers are present, their transfer rates are added together to create a total output rate for the Matrix - note that this is not per port, but for the whole Matrix. Similarly to cells, you can use differing tiers of providers. Also note that it is not required that the providers be placed next to the ports.
You don't need to fully fill the interior.
The blocks required for this quest will build the smallest possible Matrix with a single provider and cell and 2 ports, which means it can be bigger, and you can add window to it.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest73640413: While D-T Fuel can be used directly in the reactor, it's far better to use Deuterium and Tritium separately in your reactor in order to sustain the reaction.
However, we'll still need a small amount of D-T Fuel loaded into a Hohlraum in order to kickstart the reaction.
The Chemical Infuser will combine Deuterium and Tritium into D-T Fuel. Placing an empty Hohlraum into the center slot of the Chemical Infuser will load the D-T Fuel into the Hohlraum.

Tip: Since we only need a small amount of D-T Fuel, it may be worthwhile investing in a Gauge Dropper. The Gauge Dropper can be used to pick and place up to 1000 mb of fluids/gases from one machine to another.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest76850582: Now, we build the Reactor itself. It might be worthwhile to reference the Mekanism Wiki for reference pictures on the build structure as it is a unique shape.
